result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Korey M Adams

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with officers Foy, Jayce, Jazdzewski or residence other than through professional contact. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. 22-15751 $20,000.

Attorney Jakobson requests the bond be amended and makes a statement in support of same. Attorney Mogard opposes the modification.

Court denies the motion.

9:15 AM Defendant Korey M Adams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Korey M Adams.  Attorney Austin Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin.  Officer Jordan Jazdzewski is sworn and questioned by Attorney Mogard. Testifies to employment with the Wisconsin Rapids PD.  Testifies that on October 14, 2022 he was dispatched a residence in Wood County regarding a complaint of possible drug activity.  Testifies that defendant was located in a van.  Court identifies the defendant on the video.  Testifies to the items found in the vehicle.  Testifies testing conducted was positive for THC and methamphetamine.  Testifies to threats made to law enforcement by the defendant.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jakobson.  

Court takes judicial notice of Washington County Case No. 11CM1353 and Wood County Case Nos. 22CF127.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.

No contact w/ Officers Foy, Jaye and Jazdzewski other than in their professional capacity.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:41 PM Defendant Korey M Adams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Korey M Adams.  Prosecuting attorney Austin M Mogard in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Attorney Nolan-Plutchak makes an argument for a bond modification.

***Refused to sign*** No contact with officers Foy, Jane & Jazdzewski, or residence, other than through professional capacity. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  22-15751 $20,000
